result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaycee L Bocher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Ms. Bocher to  4 years  & 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp", after 9 months initial confinement
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, after 9 months initial confinement

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay 'Buy Money' reimbursement in the amount of $200
--to pay drug testing fee in the amount of $50

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--random urinalyses per agent 
--obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and with agent approval
--no possession/ ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription; take all prescribed medication as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED  that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Records Office Staff and will be based upon actual release date.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:40[mo]
Defendant Kaycee L Bocher in court, in custody with Attorney Walter Piel.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Piel indicates the parties have reached an agreement and are ready to proceed to plea and sentencing today.   
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Ms. Bocher guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court finds that this is a modified charge, in that the deliver was at or near a school. 

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count #1
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Bocher

The Court sentences Ms. Bocher  to  4 years  & 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  years & 6   months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp", after 9 months initial confinement
The Court finds that the Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, after 9 months initial confinement
 

The Court gives 81 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--random urinalyses per agent 
--obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and with agent approval
--no possession/ ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription; take all prescribed medication as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay 'Buy Money' reimbursement in the amount of $200
--to pay drug testing fee in the amount of $50 


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Right to Expungement of DNA sample information from database given 
recess:3:20pm
Six letters of support submitted by Attorney Piel w/cover letter

ADDRESS INFO for Kaycee L Bocher

Prior: 801 S. 8th St, Watertown, WI 53094

Defendants demand w/cover letter

Final status/scheduling conference on April 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 25, 2015 at 01:40 pm.
It is ordered that Atty Walter Piel be substituted as counsel
Attorney Walter Piel
Scheduling Notice

Case recalled at 9:12 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Kaycee L Bocher in court, in-custody, with Attorney Walter Arthur Piel. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Piel submits order for substitution, notice of retainer & waiver paperwork

Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Bocher waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
off-record:  9:17 - 9:19 am for scheduling
Court announces dates for the record & indicates that trial will start at 9:00 am so Atty Piel may address another matter; Court provides scheduling order to Counsel & to Clerk, Counsel indicate that they have no objection to order and will amend#10 to reflect a start of 9:00 am for trial.
Recess: 9:21 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 2/25/15 at 1:40 pm  - Send notices (2) Schedule FSSC 4/6/15 at 2:00 pm  - Send notices (3) Schedule Jury Trial 4/9/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices

Case called at 8:34 am [Clerk SH]
Attorney John Vernon Rhiel in court. Attorney Walter Piel in court for Defendant. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that Counsel requested matter be called early to address Counsel
Atty Rhiel: Was appointed by SPD, did meet with her last week & were prepared to waive preliminary hearing. Received a call on Friday that Atty Piel had been retained to represent Ms. Bocher; requests to withdraw.
Atty Piel: Confirms statements by Atty Rhiel. Do have proposed order for substitution of counsel, endorsed by Atty Rhiel, but do need Ms. Bocher's signature on that form as well
ADA Hall: No position
Court presents basis, grants Atty Rhiel to withdraw & informs parties that It intends to approve substitution of Counsel at scheduled time of 9:00 am. Court informs Atty Rhiel that he does not need to appear at 9:00 am
Recess: 8:39 am
Atty. Rhiel
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:18 pm.  Clerk  TN
Defendant Kaycee Lynne Bocher in custody via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek, from the PD Office.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Atty. Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
PD will appoint counsel.
Upon agreement of counsel, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights are given.

The Court requires a $1000 Cash Bond, with conditions: 
 
--no possession of controlled substances  
--no possession of drug paraphernalia  
--no contact with any known drug users
--Booking at JCSD


The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing
